revised_title: Optical In Situ Surface Control in MOVPE and MBE Growth
tldr: The article discusses the use of reflectance anisotropy spectroscopy and Raman scattering as in situ and online analytical tools for controlling semiconductor growth, specifically during MOVPE and MBE processes. These optical techniques provide valuable information about surface status, growth rate, growth morphology, and interface reactions, enabling better control and understanding of the growth process.
